description: Equivalent markers are treated as matching for comparison

expectedBehavior.equivalentMarkers: p/m means \p and \m are considered matching
expectedBehavior.hideMatchesEffect: Equivalent markers match when Hide Matches is enabled

sampleComparison.description: With p/m equivalence, these are considered matching

verificationNotes: Equivalent markers setting is comma-separated list of pairs
Each pair is slash-separated (p/m means p and m are equivalent)
When Hide Matches is enabled, equivalent markers are treated as matching
Marker display still shows actual marker, not equivalence group
